document_data.name: Thurnas Netmaster
document_data.mainbody: '''Thurnas Netmaster''' was the head of the slaver ring based on the [[Oasis of the White Palm]] that had taken over the [[Sandvoyagers' Guild]] in {{yearlink|1356}}, at the time of the release of the [[efreet]] [[Khalitharius]].{{cite book/Desert of Desolation|65}}
document_data.Possessions: Thurnas wielded an enchanted plate armor, and both a shield and a longsword with a stronger enchantment. His office had a small trap door which led to the [[Temple of Set]], underneath the Oasis.
document_data.Abilities: Thurnas possessed some level of heroic strength, and an optimum level of health and endurance.
document_data.Activities:
Thurnas was the leader of the slaver ring; he had replaced the guildmaster of the Sandvoyagers, Tolnus Granicus,{{cite book/Desert of Desolation|62}} modifying the guild ledgers to hide his actions{{cite book/Desert of Desolation|73}} and was currently working with drow allies. He believed the sheik's adventurers were not just wanderers who came across the oasis, and would have preferred to capture them for sale, but preferred to keep a low profile at the moment, since the dervish fanatics he had tried to deal with had grown upset with him{{cite book/Desert of Desolation|71}} Per [[Hogan Underwood]], Thurnas possessed a sand sled and used it occassionally.{{cite book/Desert of Desolation|72}}

Netmaster had sent an assassin to capture the bride, [[Zorath Blackblade]]; he had not found her. The slaver was still looking for her, though he believed the dervishes were holding her already and were trying to back out on their agreement.
